Summary: Ive seen strange lights quite a few times over the past 5yrs
trends: There have been 9 other sightings in Titusville
There were no other sightings in Titusville on or around
divs: sighting detailshi, my name is larry. i'm a 66yr semi retired senior citizen. i moved to titusville, in brevard co. fla. 5 1\2 yrs ago. my house is approx 20 miles straight west of the nasa launching facility, just across the indian river. i kinda live in the country, and at night its pretty dark, so i have a good view of the sky. some of my neighbors work there and tell me that they really have high security now since 911. about 5yrs ago, i was sitting in my front yard, (facing west, around 11:30 pm) enjoying the evening. i'm not sure why, but i was attracted to look at a fairly bright star in the western sky. as i was looking at it, it started getting brighter, and larger. it didn't seem to move or get closer, but when it was approx three or more times larger and brighter, it just disappeared. i sent an e-m to an observatory in calif but never heard back. i also sent an e to the local newspaper, and they sent me an article about venus? venus was bright, but it stayed there, and didnt disappear. it reminded me of a supernova in the scifi flicks, although i would imagine a real supernova would still be visible. about a couple yrs later, i was sitting out front again, (after midnight) and i watched this airliner flying southbound a few miles out in the western sky. as i was watching it, i became aware of some movement out of the corner of my right eye to the north. i looked to see, and i saw a blob of lights traveling southbound quite a few miles behind the airliner about the same altitude. these lights were about the same size and brightness as the stars in the sky. if they weren't moving they would be mistaken for stars. as i watched them, (there were about 8) they were moving in a group, but they were like tumbling. then they formed a triangle shape, then a diamond shape, as they seemed to be moving faster than the plane, they formed this square shape and then started tumbling in a ball shaped group again as they went out of sight. about a month ago, i was sitting out in my back yard (facing east about 2am) and as i just looked straight up in the sky. i saw these 2 flat kinda dim light circles side by side, move across the sky, (from southwest toward northeast with no sound) maybe a few thousand feet up. they reminded me of search lights, except there were no clouds to reflect off of, and there wasn't a light beam as there would be with search lights, and they didn't go in a circle, they moved straight northeast and kept going out over the indian river and out over the ocean and kept going till out of sight. soooooooo, what i was wondering is, has any one else noticed anything like this? i had the strong impression that these alien pilots don't want to alarm nasa, as the lights i saw that were close to brevard and the space coast were dim and kinda blended in with the stars, and planes and helicopters flying around here are always lit up bright as usual. well thank you for your web site, larry a. jones dewisantsavant55@aol.com
